SEARCH
Package engine.forGUI

Class Table

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
engine.forGUI.Table
public final class Table extends Observable
The Table class represents the main user interface for the Capstone chess engine. It creates a graphical chess board using Swing components and provides various features such as a menu bar, game history panel, debug panel, taken pieces panel, and the ability to observe the game with an AI watcher. The Table class initializes and displays the chess board, manages game setup, and controls the overall user experience. It also handles the graphical representation of the chess pieces and their movements during gameplay. The class follows the singleton pattern to ensure only one instance of the Table is created and used throughout the application.

Known bug: At a very rapid pace of play (1 move in invalid input: '<' .1 sec), promoted pawns will incorrectly remain pawns on the back ranks instead of repainting to a queen. Likely due to a bug in the logic in the drawBoard() method, or even in the Pawn class. There is also a possibility of a runtime error because of the rapid rate of play.

Known bug: Encountered mysterious bug when attempted to check for three-fold repetition among players. There is no indication as to what is causing the bug, but it is likely a runtime error or a logic error because it is encountered after execution. Most of the code has been deleted, or commented out, as it would likely require an overhaul to implement successfully.

Known bug: Once a game has started and the computer is thinking, it is possible to make more AI players think in parallel. This Drastically slows down the computation and glitches out the DebugPanel and the StockAlphaBeta class. A lock on selecting the buttons in the "Setup Game" menu might be required to fix this.
Author:
Aaron Ho, dareTo81

    Represents a graphical panel for an individual tile on the chessboard.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      private Table()
      Constructs an instance of the Table class, creating the main graphical user interface for the Capstone chess engine. The constructor initializes and configures various components, including the game frame, menu bar, chess board, game history panel, debug panel, taken pieces panel, and game setup options. It sets up the user interface for playing chess, including the display of chess pieces, legal move highlighting, and interaction with the user. The Table class follows the singleton pattern, ensuring that only one instance is created for managing the user interface of the chess game.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static Table get()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of the Table class, providing access to the main graphical user interface.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of the Table class.

      Retrieves the Board object representing the current state of the chess board.

    • getHighlightLegalMoves

      private boolean getHighlightLegalMoves()
      Retrieves the current status of legal move highlighting on the chess board.
      Returns:
      true if legal move highlighting is enabled, false otherwise.

    • show

      public void show()
      Refreshes and updates the graphical user interface to reflect the current state of the chess game. This method is responsible for clearing the move log, updating the game history panel, refreshing the taken pieces panel, redrawing the chess board, and updating the debug panel. The method helps ensure that the user interface accurately reflects the most recent changes and moves in the chess game. It is typically called after a move has been made to update the display accordingly.

    • populateMenuBar

      private void populateMenuBar(JMenuBar tableMenuBar)
      Populates the menu bar with Preferences and Options menus.
      Parameters:
      tableMenuBar - The JMenuBar to populate.

    • center

      private static void center(JFrame frame)
      Centers the provided JFrame on the screen.
      Parameters:
      frame - The JFrame to be centered.

    • createOptionsMenu

      private JMenu createOptionsMenu()
      This method constructs a JMenu with options to interact with the game, including starting a new game, evaluating the current board position, inspecting the current game state, undoing the last move, and setting up the game parameters. Each option is associated with a specific action when selected, such as undoing a move, displaying evaluation details, or configuring game settings.
      Returns:
      The JMenu containing gameplay options.

    • createPreferencesMenu

      private JMenu createPreferencesMenu()
      This method constructs a JMenu with options for customizing user preferences and settings related to the appearance and behavior of the chess game. Users can choose tile colors, chess piece images, highlight legal moves, and toggle book moves usage.
      Returns:
      The JMenu containing user preferences and settings.

    • playerInfo

      private static String playerInfo(Player player)
      This method constructs a string containing details about the given player's alliance, legal moves, check status, checkmate status, and castling status. The generated text provides insights into the current state of the player in the chess game.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for which to generate the information.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the player's status and legal moves.

    • updateGameBoard

      private void updateGameBoard(Board board)
      This method updates the internal state of the chess game's board to match the configuration of the provided board. It is used to synchronize the displayed game board with the actual game state.
      Parameters:
      board - The new board configuration to be applied to the game.

    • updateComputerMove

      private void updateComputerMove(Move move)
      This method updates the internal state of the computer's chosen move to the specified move. It is used to keep track of the move selected by the computer player during the game.
      Parameters:
      move - The move chosen by the computer player.

    • undoAllMoves

      private void undoAllMoves()
      This method reverses all moves that have been made in the current game session, effectively resetting the game to its initial state. It clears the move log, updates the game board and history, and redraws the board panel to reflect the reset game state.

    • undoLastMove

      private void undoLastMove()
      This method removes the last move from the move log, updates the game board state, clears the computer move, and refreshes various components of the user interface to reflect the changes after undoing the move.

    • moveMadeUpdate

      private void moveMadeUpdate(Table.PlayerType playerType)
      This method sets the state as changed and notifies registered observers with the specified player type as an argument.
      Parameters:
      playerType - The type of player (Human or Computer) who made the move.

    • setupUpdate

      private void setupUpdate(GameSetup gameSetup)
      This method sets the state as changed and notifies registered observers with the provided game setup configuration.
      Parameters:
      gameSetup - The updated game setup configuration.
